intro: Eriocoelum rivulare, commonly known as the water lily of the genus Eriocoelum, is a member of the Nymphaeaceae family. It is a semi-aquatic plant characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and marshes. Its leaves are usually green and have a waxy surface to repel water, while its flowers can be white, pink, or yellow. Eriocoelum rivulare plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
